column1: '''''Súriquessë''''' is the [[Elvish]] name of a grass.<ref name=AI>{{HM
column2: AI}}, pp. 197-8</ref><ref group="note">The name appears on unpublished drawings related to  an illustration (fig. 196) by [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: Tolkien]] depicting the grass; [[Wayne G. Hammond
column5: Scull]] describes the physical appearance of the grass as a "''tuft of radiating grass''".</ref>

column1: The name likely means "wind feather".<ref name=AI/> It has been suggested that the name is [[Quenya]],<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]], "[http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo]" (accessed 7 June 2011)</ref> and would derive from ''[[súre]]'' and ''[[quesse]]''.{{fact}}
